intro: Ozothamnus vespertinus, commonly known as the evening golden bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn, typically from September to November. Its foliage consists of narrow, grey-green leaves that are aromatic and often covered in fine hairs. Ozothamnus vespertinus is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy plant suitable for dry gardens and landscapes.
